intro: Agalma hainanense, commonly known as the Hainan agalma, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with white to pale yellow petals. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky areas. It has elliptical leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
